title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
EB: The system should display a warning or question message box before shutting down or rebooting, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s).
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected result: A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving the user a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
